free_txt: M.M. Dates were corrected for 4-digit year.
Free text was corrected to be "human-readable".
BIB information was added.Errors were added in COMMON.
Data points at 30 keV were moved in Subents 008-012.
EN was changed into KT in according to Table 3.

bib_record.title: Neutron capture cross sections on 138-Ba, 140,142-Ce, 175,176-Lu and 181-Ta at 30 keV : Prerequisite for investigation of the 176-Lu cosmic clock

free_txt: Maxwellian averaged cross section measured directly
by fitting at thermal energy KT=22-24 keV.
Used to resolve the gamma spectra from the different
isotopes. In addition the half-life of the activated
nucleus was measured as a check.

6mm diam. on copper backing of 0.5 mm. Kinematically
collimated neutron beam forming a 120 degree cone.

on the Cu backing was neglected with uncertainty
The neutron spectrum is closely approximated (Fig.4)
to a Maxwellian shape with a temperature of 22-24 keV.
